page.title: 09LOCAL COASTGUARDS
page.content:
{Sanday}has a local company of{H.M. {Coastguards.}There is a complement of about twenty members. The{Chief {Coastguard is Mr. Thomas (Tommy) {Garrioch,}who has occupied the post since 1976. They are controlled by {Pentland Coastguards}in Kirkwall. If there is an emergency, such as a missing boat or an actual shipwreck, it is Pentland Coastguards who alert the Sanday company and give them their instructions. If he knows of any local boat in trouble Tommy will call out his men himself and inform Kirkwall.
A few members keep{"bad weather watch" {when the wind is over 40 knots.}The Watch Hut, built in the 1950s, is at Savillegreen from where a wide area of local coast can be viewed. The H.Q.is situated in{Lady Village.
